definition: to welcome sb with a smiling face (idiom)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)

sentences.english: The waitress beamed a cheerful welcome to the guests.
sentences.chinese: 女服务员对宾客笑脸相迎。

sentences.english: Everyone you meet deserves to be greeted with a smile.
sentences.chinese: 遇到的每个人都值得你笑脸相迎。

sentences.english: That everyone you meet deserves to be greeted with a smile.
sentences.chinese: 每一个与你相遇的人都值得你笑脸相迎。

sentences.english: But this time folks seemed uber smiley, warm and friendly.
sentences.chinese: 但是这次，人们似乎笑脸相迎，温暖和友好。

sentences.english: The landlady is a nice person who greets all her customers with a smile.
sentences.chinese: 客气的人，对每个客人都笑脸相迎。
那位女售货员笑脸相迎。

definition: to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
smiling wholeheartedly (idiom); beaming from ear to ear
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
